user.title: EventSensor - new
user.description:
Create a **sensor entity** to show state and attributes for the last fired event of some kind.

* Set a name for the new sensor
* Select a specific Integration source for the events to listen for, or select 'Any other' to define a generic event listener.

data.name: Name for the new sensor tracking events
data.integration_source: Integration firing events to listen for

preset.title: EventSensor - listener for FoH remote
preset.description:
* Add a unique identifier to filter events related to a specific remote.
* Select a preconfigured mapping for custom states, or define a new one

data.type_identifier: Select the identifier field used to filter events for a specific remote
data.identifier: Unique identifier for device firing events (leave empty for all devices)
data.preset_config: Select one of the pre-configured state mappings, or define a generic one

state_mapping.title: EventSensor - custom state mapping
state_mapping.description:
* Review or modify the state mapping for this sensor, or leave it empty for no special state mapping.

To define a custom mapping, introduce it as pairs between commas, like:
**`code: state1, code2: state2, code3: state3`**

data.state_map: Desired mapping for the sensor states as `raw_data: pretty_state,` pairs.

generic.title: EventSensor - generic definition
generic.description:
Define a custom event listener by setting:

* Event name
* Event field `key` or `key.sub_key` to use as the sensor state
* Optional `key: value` pairs inside the event data to filter specific events
* Optional custom mapping for sensor states

To define a custom mapping, introduce it as pairs between commas, like:
**`code: state1, code2: state2, code3: state3`**
Do the same for the event data filter, **using curly braces for nested dicts if necessary**

data.state: Event field to use as sensor `state`
data.event_data: Filter with `key: value` pairs inside the event data
data.state_map: Desired mapping for the sensor states

abort.already_configured: A sensor for that specific event data is already configured
abort.forbidden_event: This sensor for events can't listen to `state_changed`

init.title: EventSensor - Edit sensor
init.description:
Edit the sensor event listener by changing:

* Sensor name
* Event name
* Event field `key` or `key.sub_key` to use as the sensor state
* Optional `key: value` pairs inside the event data to filter specific events
* Optional custom mapping for sensor states

To define a custom mapping, introduce it as pairs between commas, like:
**`code: state1, code2: state2, code3: state3`**
Do the same for the event data filter, **using curly braces for nested dicts if necessary**

data.name: Name of the sensor
data.state: Event field to use as sensor `state`
data.event_data: Optional event filter with `key: value` pairs inside the event data
